prompt_text:
You are a structured information extraction assistant. Read the following scientific abstract and extract the information into the exact JSON format below. Use only information explicitly stated in the abstract. If a field is not mentioned, use null.

Output format (JSON only, no explanation):
{
  "objective": "string — main goal of the study",
  "method": "string — methodology or approach used",
  "key_result": "string — most important quantitative or qualitative result",
  "model_or_system": "string — name of the model/system proposed (if any)",
  "benchmark": "string — evaluation benchmark or dataset used (if any)"
}
input_text: We present high quality image synthesis results using diffusion probabilistic models, a class of latent variable models inspired by considerations from nonequilibrium thermodynamics. Our best results are obtained by training on a weighted variational bound designed according to a novel connection between diffusion probabilistic models and denoising score matching with Langevin dynamics, and our models naturally admit a progressive lossy decompression scheme that can be interpreted as a generalization of autoregressive decoding. On the unconditional CIFAR10 dataset, we obtain an Inception score of 9.46 and a state-of-the-art FID score of 3.17. On 256x256 LSUN, we obtain sample quality similar to ProgressiveGAN.

environment.os_version: Darwin Kernel Version 24.6.0: Wed Nov  5 21:34:00 PST 2025; root:xnu-11417.140.69.705.2~1/RELEASE_ARM64_T8132

affiliation: UTFPR - Universidade Tecnologica Federal do Parana
output_text:
Here is the extracted information in JSON format:

{
  "objective": "present high quality image synthesis results",
  "method": "diffusion probabilistic models, weighted variational bound, denoising score matching with Langevin dynamics",
  "key_result": "Inception score of 9.46 and a state-of-the-art FID score of 3.17 on unconditional CIFAR10 dataset; sample quality similar to ProgressiveGAN on 256x256 LSUN",
  "model_or_system": null,
  "benchmark": "unconditional CIFAR10 dataset, 256x256 LSUN"
}
